myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Boaz

      this function checks for existing x' (x0<=x'<=x1) which provides a solution to the equation assuming (f(x0)*f(x1)<=0, returns f(x2) such that: * (i) x0<=x2<=x2 && (ii) f(x2)

        public void multiply(Polynom_able p1)
        this function represents multiply Polynom with other Polynom
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        p1 - = the Polynom that is multiplied to this Polynom
        c - = new Polynom that is copy of this Polynom, in order to clear this Polynom and added new values to this Polynom
        d - = pointing the next element in the iteration of it1
        g - = new Monom that gets the value of the next element in the iteration of it2 and multiply with d

      • area

        public double area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        this function Compute Riemann's Integral over this Polynom starting from x0, till x1 using eps size steps
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Specified by:
        area in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - = starting point
        x1 - = ending point
        eps - = size steps (rectangle width )
        n - = number of rectangle's
        sum - = summed the area of each rectangle
        Returns:
        the approximated area above X-axis below this function bounded in the range of [x0,x1]

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        this function checks for existing x' (x0<=x'<=x1) which provides a solution to the equation assuming (f(x0)*f(x1)<=0, returns f(x2) such that: * (i) x0<=x2<=x2 && (ii) f(x2)
        Specified by:
        root in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - step (positive) value
        Returns:
        the solution to the equation (m)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is not solution to the equation or if the eps value is greater than domain length
